Articles.Content:
I thought I couldn't explain this suggestion, so I made this:

It's a new button as you see, equalizing fuel or oxidizer, or anything can be transfer.

Comment your thoughts please.

I hope devs will see this post and comment their thoughts too.

Edited July 10, 2014 by TYRT

Really good idea, could be useful. An "AutoOut" option would be good for space stations, where you would select a tank which would automatically send fuel Out to any fuel tank (eg. on a visiting spacecraft)

I like the balance option idea but i don't think it should be automatic. if you want it auto, you should have to connect them via a "balance pipe".

any "auto functions" should have a weight and part count penalty.

I think the docking ports should have a "transfer in" "transfer out" option where it just transfers all available fuel from open tanks in to all available tanks on the side of the port.

I made a post about this yesterday:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85367-Advanced-Fuel-Management-Parts

any "auto functions" should have a weight and part count penalty.

How about requiring a "command module" on the ship in question? Seriously, this is by no means important or sophisticated enough to justify a dedicated part.

But it's a good idea nonetheless, though I don't quite understand why the OP wants to tie it to docking ports.

Regarding docking ports, I'd wish for that in addition to toggling fuel crossfeed on/off, I could also set it to let pass fuel only in one direction.
YES! YES! YES! We need this NOW!
